page.title: 17R.S.P.B. NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The Reserve area of 440 acres is part of the large forest that once surrounded Canterbury which extends to 9000 acres. The Reserve is in a block of 2000 acres North of Canterbury. One third is old woodland of native tree - species.. . New conifer plantations the remaining two thirds. The Reserve is open to anyone, families, birdwatchers, walkers and nature lovers. There are about 90 species of woodland bird including tits woodpeckers redstart wood warblers and nightingales, 30 of them breeding here. A rare butterfly, the heath fritillary is only found here and in one or two places in the West Country. The object of the Reserve is to preserve the native woodland and the ecology of the area, enabling endangered birds plants butterflies and animals to survive.
